title: What insiders are predicting for the Red Sox in free agency this offseason
author: Conor Roche
bullets: Red Sox have around $219 million in payroll, $25 million below the first luxury tax threshold.
Boston predicted as a strong contender to re-sign Alex Bregman, with contract estimates around six years, $171 million.
Red Sox listed among potential suitors for free agents Kyle Schwarber, Pete Alonso, Munetaka Murakami, and pitchers Dylan Cease and Framber Valdez.

title: Review & setlist: John Legend was a legendary pro at MGM Fenway (and he knew it)
author: Marc Hirsh
bullets: John Legend performed at MGM Music Hall at Fenway on November 7, 2025, celebrating 20 years since his debut album.
Legend mixed tracks from 'Get Lifted' with covers and medleys, showcasing both carnal and spiritual elements.
The concert included a wide range of covers such as The Beatles and Kanye West, highlighting Legend's versatile artistry.

title: Jaylen Brown seemingly criticizes officiating again following Celtics’ loss to Magic
author: Conor Roche
bullets: Jaylen Brown criticized officiating after the Celtics' 123-110 loss to the Magic, hinting at biased calls.
Brown refrained from detailed criticism but noted physical play by the Magic as impacting his performance.
In a previous game against the Jazz, Brown openly criticized a missed call but was not fined by the league.

title: 5 things to know about Buccaneers ahead of Sunday’s game vs. Patriots
author: Conor Roche
bullets: The Buccaneers are led by quarterback Baker Mayfield, who has a 6-2 record and 13 touchdowns this season.
Buccaneers rookie Emeka Egbuka, with 562 receiving yards, is a strong contender for Offensive Rookie of the Year.
Tampa Bay's defense ranks seventh in defensive DVOA and features standout players like Vita Vea and Jamel Dean.

title: Patriots’ return to relevance includes appearance by Jim Nantz in TV booth to call game for CBS
author: Chad Finn
bullets: Jim Nantz and Tony Romo will call the Patriots-Buccaneers game, their first Patriots broadcast since 2023.
Since the Patriots' dynasty, CBS's top team rarely covers them; they last called a Patriots game during Week 6, 2023.
CBS assigned Nantz and Romo to this game, highlighting the Patriots' revival under quarterback Drake Maye and coach Mike Vrabel.

title: Magic pull away, beat Celtics despite another big Jaylen Brown game: 8 takeaways
author: Tom Westerholm
bullets: Magic beat Celtics 123-110, handing Boston its first NBA Cup loss despite Jaylen Brown's 32-point performance.
Celtics struggled from three-point range; Jaylen Brown, Sam Hauser, and Derrick White combined for 3-for-17 shooting.
Celtics' backup centers and defense faltered, allowing Magic to score 38 and 39 in opening and final quarters.

title: Public reprimand recommended for judge accused of helping immigrant escape ICE
author: Morgan Rousseau
bullets: Judge Shelley Joseph recommended for public reprimand for creating 'appearance of impropriety' in 2018 ICE escape case.
Hearing officer found Joseph unaware of the escape plan but allowed off-record ICE discussion, violating court rules.
Federal charges against Joseph dropped in 2022; she was suspended due to allegations of aiding a migrant's courthouse escape.

title: Alex Cora still high on Red Sox’ future a month after being eliminated by Yankees
author: Kaley Brown
bullets: Boston Red Sox were eliminated by the Yankees in the AL Wild Card Series, losing two games to one.
Manager Alex Cora expressed optimism for the 2026 season despite roster uncertainties and offseason changes.
Key changes include Alex Bregman opting out, Trevor Story staying, and Lucas Giolito not receiving a qualifying offer.

title: Giant blade breaks off Mass. wind turbine
author: Morgan Rousseau
bullets: A wind turbine blade, 75 to 100 feet long, detached in Plymouth, landing in a cranberry bog.
No injuries were reported, and the turbine shut down automatically in fail-safe mode.
The incident is under investigation by MassDEP and Inspectional Services for safety compliance.

title: 5 must-watch movies & TV shows streaming right now
author: Kevin Slane
bullets: 'The Fantastic Four: First Steps' starts streaming on Disney+, introducing a new Marvel adaptation directed by Guillermo del Toro.
'Frankenstein', a Guillermo del Toro film featuring Jacob Elordi and Oscar Isaac, is now streaming on Netflix.
'Death by Lightning', a Netflix series about President James A. Garfield, stars Michael Shannon and Matthew Macfadyen.
